article.headline: Hereâs whatâs coming to Hulu in October 2020, and whatâs leaving
article.body: Hulu is getting spooky just in time for Halloween, with a slate of creepy originals debuting in October 2020. They include âMonsterlandâ (Oct. 2), an anthology series based on Nathan Ballingrudâs book âNorth American Lake Monstersâ; âBooks of Bloodâ (Oct. 7), a movie that puts a new spin on the Clive Barker stories; âHelstromâ (Oct. 16), a Marvel Comics adaptation about a brother and sister â whose father was a serial killer â battling the forces of evil; and âBad Hairâ (Oct. 23), a horror satire from âDear White Peopleâ writer/producer Justin Simien about a Black woman whose new weave appears to have a mind of its own. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } Aside from originals, the streaming service controlled by Walt Disney Co. DIS, +1.53% Â will also have next-day episodes of new network TV shows including âSaturday Night Liveâ (Oct. 4), âThe Bacheloretteâ (Oct. 14), âThe Voiceâ (Oct. 20) and âSuperstoreâ (Oct. 23), and a ton of Halloween-ey movies, including âHouse of 1,000 Corpses,â âInterview With the Vampireâ and âWhen a Stranger Callsâ (all Oct. 1). See more: Whatâs coming in October to Netflix | Amazon Prime Video Also read:âThe Mandalorianâ returns, but what other streaming picks are worth paying for in October 2020? And a heads up: âParks and Recreationâ is leaving Hulu (and Netflix, and Amazon Prime Video) on Sept. 30, and moving to its new, exclusive streaming home at Peacock.
